feed.title: NewsTracker: ferguson
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: State of emergency ends in Ferguson as violence recedes
entry.summary:
Ferguson saw a fresh wave of demonstrations beginning last weekend, marking the one-year anniversary of the death of Michael Brown, an unarmed 18-year-old black man shot by a white police officer last August.

In the days since then, other protests have continued in and around Ferguson.

entry.title: Ferguson defends interim chief after concerns raised
entry.summary:
Ferguson city officials on Friday defended interim Police Chief Andre Anderson after an online report raised concerns about his record as an officer in Glendale, Arizona.

Anderson, who is on leave from the Arizona department while he works in Ferguson in suburban St. Louis, has been promoted several times in Glendale and his records show generally favorable, sometimes glowing, reviews.

entry.title: Ferguson defends interim chief after concerns raised
entry.summary: The statement from the city of Ferguson said Anderson was hired following a process that included a background investigation "independent of the City Manager."

entry.title: State of Emergency in Ferguson Is Lifted as Protests Ease
entry.summary: "After reviewing the events of the past four evenings under the state of emergency, I am pleased to report our law enforcement officers have established order while preventing further acts of violence in Ferguson," Mr. Stenger said in a statement.

entry.title: County Halts Ferguson State of Emergency; Police Vigilant
County halts Ferguson state of emergency; police vigilant
entry.summary: (AP) - St. Louis County has lifted the state of emergency that was imposed in Ferguson and the surrounding area after shootings during protests to mark the anniversary of Michael Brown's death.

entry.title: National Briefing | Midwest: Missouri: State of Emergency Stays in Place in Ferguson
entry.summary: Ferguson will remain under a state of emergency for at least another night, county officials said on Wednesday.

entry.title: CTV says reporter charged a year after arrest while covering Ferguson protests
entry.summary: TORONTO -- CTV says its Los Angeles bureau chief has been charged nearly a year after his arrest while covering the protests in Ferguson, Mo.

entry.title: After 2 nights of tension, a peaceful protest in Ferguson
entry.summary: Police outnumbered protesters along West Florissant Avenue in Ferguson on Tuesday night, signaling the demonstrations around the anniversary of Michael Brown's death could be starting to fade.

entry.title: Protesters gather in Ferguson for peaceful demonstration
Protesters gather in Ferguson for peaceful demonstration
entry.summary:
Cat Daniels puts out snacks as smaller group of protesters gather along West Florissant Avenue in Ferguson, Mo., Tuesday.

About 100 protesters gathered along West Florissant Avenue in Ferguson late Tuesday in a demonstration that was decidedly smaller and calmer than others on recent nights.

entry.title: Police release video of man holding gun before being shot in Ferguson
entry.summary: Stenger commended the efforts of the county police, along with the contributions from Ferguson and other departments, for minimizing tensions Monday night.

entry.title: Police release video they say shows Ferguson suspect with gun
entry.summary:
St. Louis County Police released a video on Tuesday that they said shows a suspect, who has been accused of firing on police, drawing a pistol from his pants during protests in strife-torn Ferguson, Missouri.

Police take a mug shot of a protester who was detained in Ferguson, Missouri, August 10, 2015.

entry.title: Ferguson police release video they say shows suspect in police shooting
entry.summary: -- St. Louis County police have released surveillance video footage they say shows the 18-year-old black suspect who was critically wounded after being shot by police in Ferguson minutes before he fired a gun at plainclothes officers.

entry.title: Oath Keepers return to Ferguson as protests dwindle
entry.summary:
Larry Miller, 58, organizer of the protest group Ferguson Freedom Fighters, said it was clear the latest round of demonstrations were dying down.

John Karriman, an Oath Keepers leader from southwest Missouri, said members plan to remain in Ferguson at least through the end of the week.

entry.title: The Latest on Ferguson: Video released of alleged gunman
entry.summary:
Ronald Johnson confer, Monday, Aug. 10, 2015, in Ferguson, Mo.

Ferguson was a community on edge again Monday, a day after a protest marking the anniversary of Michael Brown's death was punctuated with gunshots.

entry.title: The Latest on Ferguson: Video Released of Alleged Gunman
Oath Keepers’ return criticized in Ferguson
Oath Keepers’ return criticized in Ferguson
entry.summary: Heavily armed civilians with a group known as the Oath Keepers arrive in Ferguson, Mo., early Tuesday, Aug. 11, 2015.

entry.title: Return of armed militia group Oath Keepers to Ferguson raises concern
entry.summary: He said members plan to remain in Ferguson "at least through the end of the week."

entry.title: Armed Militia Group's Return to Ferguson Raises Concern
4th night of Ferguson protests brings confrontation, arrests
entry.summary: The violence set Ferguson on edge and had protest leaders worried that tensions could escalate.

entry.title: 4th night of Ferguson protests brings confrontation, arrests
entry.summary:
The St. Louis suburb thoroughfare was the focus of months of massive protests and sometimes violent unrest last summer after the killing of Brown by a Ferguson police officer.

Protests also cropped up outside Ferguson.

entry.title: 4th night of Ferguson protests brings confrontation, arrests
entry.summary: Police arrested nearly two dozen people in Ferguson during a fourth consecutive night of demonstrations marking the anniversary of the fatal shooting of 18-year-old Michael Brown.

entry.title: 4th night of Ferguson protests brings confrontation, arrests
entry.summary: Protests also spilled outside of Ferguson earlier Monday.

entry.title: The Latest on Ferguson: Nearly 2 dozen arrests at protest
entry.summary:
A St. Louis County Police spokesman says about two dozen people were arrested during a protest along West Florissant Avenue in Ferguson.

Hundreds of people gathered along West Florissant, the thoroughfare that was the site of massive protests and rioting after 18-year-old Michael Brown was fatally shot last year in a confrontation with a Ferguson police officer.

entry.title: The Latest on Ferguson: Nearly 2 dozen arrests at protest
The Latest on Ferguson: Crowd at protest diminishing
entry.summary:
Officers arrest a protester, Monday, Aug. 10, 2015, in Ferguson, Mo.

Police have made nine arrests in Ferguson after protesters blocked a traffic lane on West Florissant Avenue.

entry.title: The Latest on Ferguson: Crowd at protest diminishing
entry.summary:
The crowd of protesters in Ferguson has significantly diminished along West Florissant Avenue.

Around midnight, a group of more than 50 protesters began marching down the middle of West Florissant Avenue in Ferguson, defying orders from police to clear the roadway.

entry.title: News24.com | Police shooting, protests put Ferguson back on edge
entry.summary: Michael Brown was a black 18-year-old who was killed by a white Ferguson police officer, touching off a national debate over police treatment of minorities and sparked the "Black Lives Matter" movement.

entry.title: Police shooting, protests put Ferguson back on edge
entry.summary:
Family, friends and supporters pause for a moment of silence at a memorial to Michael Brown, Sunday, Aug. 9, 2015, in Ferguson, Mo.

Michael Brown Sr., right, hugs his wife, Cal Brown, at the spot where his son, Michael Brown, was killed one year ago Sunday, Aug. 9, 2015, in Ferguson, Mo.

entry.title: The Latest on Ferguson: Arrests made along West Florissant
entry.summary: Police take cover as a barrage of gunfire erupts along West Florrisant Street during a demonstration to mark the 1-year anniversary of the shooting of Michael Brown on August 9, 2015 in Ferguson, Missouri.

entry.title: Police arrest protesters in Ferguson
entry.summary:
I strongly condemn the violence against the community, including police officers, in Ferguson, Missouri.

Newly appointed Ferguson Police Chief Andre Anderson shakes hands with participants during a march of solidarity for Michael Brown on West Florissant Avenue in Ferguson, Mo.

entry.title: Armed 'Oath Keepers' arrive in Ferguson
Arrested in Ferguson Last Year, Washington Post Reporter Is Charged
entry.summary: A reporter for The Washington Post, arrested while covering the protests in Ferguson, Mo., last August, has been charged with trespassing, the newspaper said Monday.

entry.title: The Latest on Ferguson: Arrests made along West Florissant
entry.summary: Kansas City police arrested four people during a protest marking the anniversary of the police shooting that killed Michael Brown in Ferguson.

entry.title: Man shot at Ferguson rally charged
Police shooting, protests put Ferguson back on edge
entry.summary: "Of course I'm worried," said Sandy Sansevere, a retired health care worker who volunteers at the retail store operated by the nonprofit group I Love Ferguson, which was formed after Brown's death to promote the community.

entry.title: Ferguson: State of emergency set after anniversary violence
entry.summary: Authorities declared a state of emergency in Ferguson, Missouri, after gunfire erupted on the anniversary of a high-profile police shooting and prosecutors on Monday charged an 18-year-old man with assault on officers.

entry.title: St. Louis County issues state of emergency in Ferguson
entry.summary:
It was not immediately clear if the latest police shooting of a black suspect would spur renewed unrest in Ferguson, the site of many protests - some violent - in the aftermath of Brown's death Aug. 9, 2014.

Tyrone Harris Sr. told The Associated Press his son was a close friend of Brown and was in Ferguson on Sunday night to pay respects.

entry.title: State of emergency declared in Ferguson after shooting anniversary violence
entry.summary: "In light of last night's violence and unrest in the city of Ferguson, and the potential for harm to persons and property, I am exercising my authority as county executive to issue a state of emergency, effective immediately," he said.

entry.title: Police in new Ferguson lockdown
entry.summary: St. Louis County Executive Steve Stenger issued the order in a move that authorises county Police Chief Jon Belmar to take control of police emergency management in and around Ferguson.

entry.title: Attorney General Lynch 'condemns' new violence in Ferguson
Man who opened fire on officers in Ferguson critically injured: County police chief [Photos] [Video]
entry.summary: -- A man who authorities say opened fire on officers in Ferguson, Missouri, on the anniversary of Michael Brown's death was critically wounded when the officers shot back, St. Louis County's police chief said early Monday.

entry.title: State of emergency declared in wake of renewed Ferguson violence
entry.summary: Police form a line across West Florissant Ave. during a protest, Sunday, Aug. 9, 2015, in Ferguson, Mo.

entry.title: State of emergency declared in wake of renewed Ferguson violence
entry.summary: Police stand near a suspect in a parking lot after gunfire during a protest on the anniversary of the death of Michael Brown, Sunday, Aug. 9, 2015, in Ferguson, Mo.

entry.title: Man shot, critically injured in Ferguson
entry.summary: Ferguson Interim Police Chief Andre Anderson, right, tries to calm the crowd after a shooting near a protest in Ferguson, Mo., on Aug. 10, 2015.

entry.title: Man shot, critically injured in Ferguson
State of emergency declared in Ferguson
entry.summary: Michael Brown Sr. drops off stuffed animals at a memorial to his son, Michael Brown, before taking part in a parade in his son's honor in Ferguson, Mo.

entry.title: Ferguson marks anniversary of Michael Brown's death [Photos] [Video]
entry.summary:
Michael Brown Sr., center, takes part in a parade in honor of his son, Michael Brown, Saturday, Aug. 8, 2015, in Ferguson, Mo.

Sunday marks one year since Michael Brown was shot and killed by Ferguson police officer Darren Wilson.

entry.title: A year after Michael Brown's death, Ferguson has changed
entry.summary: A year ago, Ferguson was thrust into the national spotlight after the death of Brown giving way to the "Black Lives Matter" movement.

entry.title: A year after Michael Brown’s death, Ferguson has changed
entry.summary:
Mercedes Harris, left, Theresa Reed, center, and Corliss Wade pray together at a community gathering in Ferguson, Mo., on July 25, 2015.

In this July 25, 2015, photo, children hold balloons at a community gathering in Ferguson, Mo.

entry.title: A year after Michael Brown’s death, Ferguson has changed
entry.summary: Within weeks of Michael Brown's death, Ferguson police began wearing the cameras that were donated to the city.

entry.title: A year after Michael Brown's death, a changed Ferguson tries to move beyond shooting, protests
entry.summary:
All Ferguson officers wear body cameras.

But at the same time, the government issued a report so critical of Ferguson's police and municipal court system that it hastened an upheaval in the town of 21,000 people, two-thirds of them black.

-- A year ago, Ferguson, Mo., was a mostly quiet working-class suburban town.

entry.title: A year after Michael Brown's death, a changed Ferguson tries to move beyond shooting, protests [Video]
entry.summary: At the time of the shooting, just three of Ferguson's 53 officers were black.

entry.title: Ferguson, one year later: What’s happening this weekend
entry.summary:
The Ferguson police force of 50 will be fully staffed this weekend and will have the help of the much larger St. Louis County police force, he said.

Ferguson Mayor James Knowles said the city has made many reforms in the last year, though it still has more to do.

entry.title: Year later, AP reporter recalls origins of Ferguson movement
entry.summary: Ferguson became the impetus for a national movement.

entry.title: Commentary: On the origins of the Ferguson movement, a year later
entry.summary:
On Aug. 9, I returned home from a bike ride to learn that a young black man had been fatally shot by a white Ferguson police officer.

What we didn?t know at the time was the depth of mistrust between black residents and the predominantly white Ferguson Police Department, a level of suspicion that no doubt fueled what happened next.

entry.title: Year later, AP reporter recalls origins of Ferguson movement
entry.summary:
ST. LOUIS (AP) - EDITOR'S NOTE - A year ago, most Americans had never heard of the St. Louis suburb called Ferguson.

Until August 2014, Ferguson, Missouri, wasn't the kind of place that generated much news.

My wife's grandmother lived in Ferguson until she died in 1991, so I spent some time there as a young man.

But since joining the St. Louis office of The Associated Press in 1993, I had never been to Ferguson as a reporter.

The next day, as Ferguson police prepared for a news conference to explain what happened, I was among a crowd of reporters who heard distant chanting.

Never before had the anger been as intense as in Ferguson.

entry.title: Ferguson spurs 40 new state measures; activists want more
entry.summary: FILE - In this undated photo provided by the Brown family is Michael Brown, a young black man who was fatally shot on Aug. 9, 2014 by a white Ferguson, Mo., policeman.

entry.title: Ferguson spurs 40 new state measures; activists want more
entry.summary:
FILE - In this Aug. 9, 2014, file photo, a police tactical team moves in to disperse a group of protesters following the shooting of a young black man by a white policeman in Ferguson, Mo.

When a white Ferguson policeman fatally shot a young black man nearly a year ago, the St. Louis suburb erupted in violent protests and the nation took notice.

entry.title: Ferguson spurs 40 new state measures; activists want more
entry.summary:
Numerous cities from coast-to-coast, including Ferguson, also began using the cameras without waiting for legislative direction.

Any Ferguson-inspired changes should focus on training police commanders to make better decisions on when and how to use their officers and equipment, said Jim Pasco, executive director of the Fraternal Order of Police.

Police unions still hold considerable sway in some states, including in Missouri, where lawmakers filed about 65 bills stemming from the events in Ferguson.

"As a state, we have not done much," said Missouri state Sen. Maria Chappelle-Nadal, who represents Ferguson and was among the protesters who were tear-gassed by police.

entry.title: Ferguson spurs 40 new state measures; activists want more
Ferguson spurs 40 new state measures; activists want more
entry.summary:
Chappelle-Nadal, who was among the those tear gassed by police while protesting Michael Brown's shooting with her constituents in Ferguson, Mo., said as a state, Missouri has not done much.

Lawmakers filed about 65 bills stemming from the events in Ferguson passing just one, a measure limiting municipal court fines and traffic tickets.

ADVANCE FOR MONDAY, AUG. 3, 2015 AND THEREAFTER - FILE - In this Aug. 20, 2014 file photo, protesters march in the street as lightning flashes in the distance in Ferguson, Mo.

entry.title: Ferguson presses several-hour, unity-minded cleanup effort ahead of Brown anniversary
Ferguson presses cleanup bid ahead of Brown anniversary
entry.summary:
One of the areas hardest hit by last year's unrest in Ferguson, Missouri, that followed the police shooting death of 18-year-old Michael Brown is getting a little sprucing.

An organizer, Roy Gillespie, says the cleanup was less about beautification than it was about building regional unity by drawing in Ferguson residents and outsiders to pitch in.

entry.title: National Briefing | Midwest: Missouri: Arizona Commander Will Lead Ferguson Police
entry.summary: Thomas Jackson, Ferguson's police chief for five years, resigned days after that report.

entry.title: Ferguson hires Arizona black police commander as interim chief
entry.summary: Andre Anderson speaks with Ferguson City Council member Wesley Bell, right, after being introduced as the the interim chief of the Ferguson Police Department during a news conference on Wednesday, July 22, 2015, in Ferguson, Mo.

entry.title: Ferguson hires black police chief
entry.summary: He said he is interested in becoming Ferguson's permanent police chief.

entry.title: Ferguson Hires Interim Police Chief
entry.summary: Ferguson Hires Interim Police Chief The Ferguson police force has changed leadership again, with a third chief in four months.

entry.title: Ferguson names black interim police chief
Ferguson hires another interim police chief
entry.summary:
Anderson previously was police commander in the Phoenix suburb of Glendale, Arizona - the same city from which Ferguson recently hired its interim city manager, Ed Beasley.

Following the report, Ferguson's municipal judge, city manager and Police Chief Tom Jackson resigned.

entry.title: Ferguson hires Andre Anderson as new interim police chief
Ferguson to hire new interim police chief
entry.summary: Glendale is the same city where Ferguson leaders chose its interim city manager, Ed Beasley.

entry.title: Ferguson to hire another interim police chief as anniversary of Michael Brown's death nears
entry.summary: FERGUSON, Mo.
